intro: Mullaghera conjugata, commonly known as the slender false nettle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle species, and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Mullaghera conjugata is typically herbaceous, with a creeping growth habit, and it can spread through rhizomes. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystems it inhabits.
